response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<String[]> it = getIdAndName().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
String id = it.next()[0];
String name = it.next()[1];
names.add(id + ": " + name);
}
<<<explanation>>>: When you iterate over a Vector<String[]>, the .next() method returns an Object that needs to be casted to String[] because the Vector stores objects of type String[] instead of String. To access the elements of the String[] array, you need to cast it to String[] and then access the elements using the array indexing operator [].
